thread.title: Chelsea transfer news: Romelu Lukaku hints at Everton exit and Stamford Bridge return with Champions League tweet
thread.title_full: Chelsea transfer news: Romelu Lukaku hints at Everton exit and Stamford Bridge return with Champions League tweet

author: achapman
title: Chelsea transfer news: Romelu Lukaku hints at Everton exit and Stamford Bridge return with Champions League tweet
text:
London Calling Chelsea transfer news: Romelu Lukaku hints at Everton exit and Stamford Bridge return with Champions League tweet 
Belgian ace strongly linked with move back to Stamford Bridge this summer as a potential replacement for Diego Costa By ANTHONY CHAPMAN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ROMELU LUKAKU has reportedly dropped a huge hint that he could be set for a return to Chelsea this summer. 
The Everton striker left the Blues for a loan stint at Goodison Park in 2013 before making the move permanent a year later. Getty Images 5 Romelu Lukaku appears to have hinted at a possible Chelsea return, reports claim 
Lukaku has since gone on to become a smash hit for the Toffees, bagging an incredible 78 goals in just 153 appearances. Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Italian giants Juventus have also been linked , with chiefs at the Serie A club close to Lukaku’s agent Mino Raiola . Getty Images The Belgian last played for Chelsea in 2013 Romelu Lukaku scores the joint-fastest goal of season against Bournemouth Twitter/@RomeluLukaku9 5 Lukaku posted the cryptic tweet last night 
But the Express claims the Belgian is heading back to Stamford Bridge after dropping a cryptic tweet last night. 
It read: “UCL is where reputations are built… what a competition, what a game.” Related Articles We're rank outsiders Uefa's new rankings have been released - and Chelsea are the only English club in the top ten SCOUTING FOR TALENT Chelsea boss Antonio Conte to send scout to watch Inter Milan star Ivan Perisic this weekend MARCEL'S DES-TINY Chelsea legend Marcel Desailly hotly tipped for Ghana job after Avram Grant leaves Black Stars forking liberty Chelsea's John Terry wanted new cutlery brought to him every lunch, claims former Blues youngster Getty Images Lukaku could arrive at Stamford Bridge as a replacement for Diego Costa Getty Images 5 Lukaku is also believed to be a target for Juventus 
Chelsea are all-but-guaranteed a place in Europe’s elite tournament next season as they lead the race for the title by eight points. 
But much will depend on the future of Costa, with Conte’s Blues currently playing with just a single striker in a 3-4-3 formation.
